meaningMnemonic:
The <kanji>pressure</kanji> is <kanji>urge</kanji>d upon you. It's the <vocabulary>pressure</vocabulary>, so much pressure!

圧迫 refers to a tight pressure caused by strong compression, or to the act of pressing down itself. Figuratively, it can also mean <vocabulary>constriction</vocabulary>, like tuition fees putting a strain on a household budget, or <vocabulary>oppression</vocabulary>, such as people being subjugated.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The あつ turns into a small っ, and はく goes to ぱく.
